messages.content:
Write this command to below is just an wireframe creation example but you need to create wireframe based on the user prompt`.sureai/io8_mcp/requests/create_wireframe.txt` and execute it:
```
gemini yolo command with this as prompt "create_wireframe_raw(moduleId='[MODULE_ID_FROM_PROJECT_RESPONSE]', backendId='[BACKEND_ID_FROM_PROJECT_RESPONSE]', jsonString='{\"wireframeName\":\"[WIREFRAME_NAME]\",\"fields\":[{\"name\":\"Name\",\"type\":\"text\"},{\"name\":\"Email\",\"type\":\"email\"},{\"name\":\"Age\",\"type\":\"number\"}]}')"

Now from the create_project.out pick the backendResp id value and moduleResp id value for creating writeframe as per the user prompt. Refer the architecture document for user prompt updated document for creating the wireframe above is an example and using io8 mcp tool create_wireframe_raw save the response in json to `io8_mcp/responses/create_wireframe.out`

user prompt: To-Do app
The wireframe for the "To-Do app" has been created and the response saved to `/tmp/bmad_output/to_do_app_20250922_093350/io8_mcp/responses/create_wireframe.out`.

thoughts.subject: Initiating Design Workflow
thoughts.description: I'm currently focused on the To-Do app wireframe. My priority is extracting essential IDs: the `backendResp id` and the `moduleResp id` from `create_project.out`. Simultaneously, I'm reviewing the `architecture_document.md` to grasp the core user requirements that will guide the visual design. This will enable me to start constructing the initial wireframe design.

thoughts.subject: Analyzing Task Requirements
thoughts.description: I've shifted focus to defining the tasks for wireframe creation. Specifically, I'm parsing the 'create_project.out' file to retrieve crucial `backendResp id` and `moduleResp id` values. Concurrently, I'm deeply examining the `architecture_document.md`, aiming to precisely understand the "To-Do app" prompt's specifications. This involves translating user requirements into a structured `jsonString` format, which is essential for the `create_wireframe_raw` tool. Ultimately, I'll leverage these components to craft the wireframe and store the response. My initial step is extracting the IDs from the project output.

thoughts.subject: Examining IDs and Docs
thoughts.description: I've just pulled the IDs, 2455 and 47738, from the `create_project.out` file.  My next step is to dive into the `architecture_document.md` file. I'm keen to understand the user's wireframe prompt to put the data into context.

thoughts.subject: Uncovering the Core Data
thoughts.description: I have successfully parsed the IDs, 2455 and 47738, from the `create_project.out` output. I'm now setting my sights on the `architecture_document.md` file, hoping to gain valuable insights into the user's wireframe prompt, specifically regarding the "To-Do app".

thoughts.subject: Considering the Architecture
thoughts.description: I've been meticulously examining the `architecture_document.md` file, which outlines a "To-Do" app. The MVC design, local storage for data, and the component breakdown—`TaskListComponent`, `TaskItemComponent`, `AddTaskComponent`, and `EditTaskComponent`—are all taking shape in my mind.

thoughts.subject: Defining the Task Fields
thoughts.description: I'm now zeroing in on the specific data structure for the "To-Do" app tasks. I've decided on the essential fields: an `id` (number), `description` (text), optional `dueDate` (date), optional `priority` (text), and `completed` status (boolean). This structure will guide the creation of the JSON string for the wireframe. I'm preparing the string, and soon, I'll be calling `create_wireframe_raw`.

thoughts.subject: Finalizing Wireframe Output
thoughts.description: I've successfully generated the wireframe. My immediate task is to save the output of the response to `io 8_mcp/responses/create_wireframe.out`. This completes the initial stage of this process.

thoughts.subject: Delivering the Final Product
thoughts.description: I've finalized the core output, efficiently producing and storing the requested file. The goal is met, and I'm ready for the next task.
